com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.mediagroup.signals
Class SignalDetectorTest

java.lang.Object

          com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.TestBase

                  com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.mediagroup.signals.SignalDetectorTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class SignalDetectorTest
extends MediaSessionBase

Explore the most usual features of the SignalDetector.
They include catching one or a few DTMFs known in advance (like menu entry keys), catching a number of unknown DTMFs (like a PIN number), and catching a {PIN or terminator}.

All testcases use a PatternChecker.

test_2_1_3_10_ReceivePoundOr4Digits

public void test_2_1_3_10_ReceivePoundOr4Digits()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Define numSignals=4, pattern0="#".
Must return "1234".

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_3_11_Receive4DigitsOrDTMF3

public void test_2_1_3_11_Receive4DigitsOrDTMF3()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Define numSignals=4, pattern0="3", FILTERED_PATTERNS={pattern0}.
Must return "12": pattern0 stops the collection, and the last "3" is removed because of FILTERED_PATTERNS.
( pattern0 works as a terminator, like "#" in usual applications)

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
